intro: Taraxacum glandonense, commonly known as the Glandonese dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of elongated, hairy leaves and a yellow flower head that develops into a white, fluffy seed head. Native to specific regions in South America, it thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and forest clearings. The plant produces small, wind-dispersed seeds, which contribute to its ability to colonize new areas. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential medicinal research.
